latestVersion.termsOfAccess:
Project files like raw data, coding guidelines and questionnaires can now be directly downloaded from this site.
Please see also SSD's Farm Household Survey Database (http://ricestat.irri.org/fhsd/).
latestVersion.dataAccessPlace: All files for this project/study, except for the Project Description, need to be directly downloaded from SSD's Farm Household Survey Database's online link: http://ricestat.irri.org/fhsd/

fields.value: Reaching Toward Optimal Productivity (RTOP) with Socio-economic component

dsDescriptionValue.value: The major objectives of this project are to  a) understand the socioeconomic and technological differences in intensive irrigated rice production system across Asia in order to provide information on the context within which technology adoption (ex. SSNM) takes place,   b) to assess the trends in productivity at the farm level in a large number of intensive irrigated farming systems.

keywordValue.value: Detailed data on farm inputs, outputs, prices and cultural practices

fields.value: Subject: Number of respondents  Type: Sample size  Notes: Varies from 20-40 depending upon the sites and season of the year;

otherGeographicCoverage.value: Philippines, Thailand, Indonesia, Vietnam, India, and China

value: Central Luzon, Philippines; Central plain, Thailand; West Java, Indonesia; Mekong Delta and Red River Delta, Vietnam; Tamil Nadu, India; and Zhejiang, China
